publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-1779 Robin Harper: Support for Outdoor Education—That the Parliament calls on the Scottish Executive, in light of the publication of Outdoor education: Aspects of good practice, by Ofsted which found that there has been a decline in outdoor education activity in England and Wales partly due to teachers’ fears of risk and litigation, to commission and publish a study of the state of outdoor education in Scotland that identifies trends and, after consultation with the Educational Institute for Scotland and other unions, introduces such strategies, legislation and support as will be necessary to encourage teachers to continue providing outdoor education, to make outdoor education and education in the outdoors core educational activities and to provide assurances that any teacher fulfilling all reasonable safety and risk procedures and assessments will be safe in the face of litigation. Supported by: Eleanor Scott*, Mr Mark Ruskell*, Murray Tosh*, Fergus Ewing*, Roseanna Cunningham*, Linda Fabiani*, Carolyn Leckie*
S2M-1779 Support for Outdoor Education (lodged on 28 September 2004) John Farquhar Munro*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*, Patrick Harvie*, Frances Curran*, Mark Ballard*, Mike Pringle*
S2M-1779 Support for Outdoor Education (lodged on 28 September 2004) Dennis Canavan*, Tommy Sheridan*
